intro: Calyptranthes rigida var. apicata, commonly known as the rigid calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other aromatic plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a leathery texture, while the bark is smooth and often exhibits a reddish hue. This species is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
